snippet: The venerable opera company, which filed for bankruptcy protection in 2013, will be taken over by the NYCO Renaissance, which hopes to use the City Opera name by next week.
abstract: Manhattan bankruptcy court Judge Sean H Lane approves NYCO Renaissance’s proposal to revive New York City Opera, which filed for bankruptcy in 2013; approval, made after objections to plan by state attorney general were satisfied, clears way for new organization to proceed with production of Puccini’s opera Tosca.
lead_paragraph: The venerable opera company, which filed for bankruptcy protection in 2013, will be taken over by the NYCO Renaissance, which hopes to use the City Opera name by next week.

headline.main: New York City Opera Will Return, and Soon, Under Reorganization Plan
headline.print_headline: New York City Opera Will Return, and Soon, Under Court-Approved Plan
